1.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

2.text: How long will you speak these things? and how long shall the words of your mouth be like a strong wind?

3.text: Does God pervert judgment? or does the Almighty pervert justice?

4.text: If your children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;

5.text: If you would seek to God betimes, and make your supplication to the Almighty;

6.text: If you were pure and upright; surely now he would awake for you, and make the habitation of your righteousness prosperous.

7.text: Though your beginning was small, yet your latter end should greatly increase.

8.text: For inquire, I pray you, of the former age, and prepare yourself to the search of their fathers:

9.text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days on earth are a shadow:)

10.text: Shall not they teach you, and tell you, and utter words out of their heart?

11.text: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?

12.text: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it wither before any other herb.

13.text: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:

14.text: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.

15.text: He shall lean on his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.

16.text: He is green before the sun, and his branch shoots forth in his garden.

17.text: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and sees the place of stones.

18.text: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen you.

19.text: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.

20.text: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

21.text: Till he fill your mouth with laughing, and your lips with rejoicing.

22.text: They that hate you shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nothing.
